Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery krater, probably bell-krater; inside glazed with reserved band. Outside, part of head of balding satyr facing left.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 102 no. 352 pl. 75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1020)
